params.chat_instruct_command:
Continue the chat dialogue below. Write a single reply for the character "<|character|>".

<|prompt|>
params.user_input:
You have an incorrect format in your response. 
Here is a reminder of the rules:
You MUST NOT use the colleges' real names.
You MUST refer to the colleges as A or B. 
You MUST NOT make up a preference when there is no preference in the comment.
You MUST respond with ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond with ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond with ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.
You MUST respond with ```A is preferred over B```, ```B is preferred over A```, or ```Equal preference```.

internal:
College A: ```Washington University in St. Louis```
College B: ```Bowdoin College```
Comment: ```@reindeercoffee what country do you currently live in?  Maine and Missouri are definitely different.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

College A: ```University of Michigan```
College B: ```Massachusetts Institute of Technology```
Comment: ```Another vote here for Michigan.  Great school and you’re getting the deal of the century cost-wise.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```University of Richmond```
College B: ```Haverford College```
Comment: ```It sounds like you want Haverford. Maybe you should go with your gut as they are both great schools.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```Pomona College```
College B: ```Johns Hopkins University```
Comment: ```I don’t see any “wrong” choice here, not do I see any “perfect” choice.  Pick one and don’t look back.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

College A: ```Amherst College```
College B: ```Harvey Mudd College```
Comment: ```Amherst is great for pre-med, but maybe not so good for engineering. The only way to get an engineering degree at Amherst would be through a 5-year program, where you spend years 3 and 5 at Dartmouth. Such programs are commonly offered by liberal arts colleges, but rarely utilized in practice;. Amherst says that only one or two students per class go that route. http://www3.amherst.edu/~waloinaz/engineering.html HMC is great for engineering, but maybe not so good for pre-med. HMC does offer common pre-med majors, like biology and chemistry, although they are less popular than engineering. However, it may be difficult to maintain a high GPA at Mudd, as noted above, especially if you also want to swim competitively:  [quote] Prospective pre-medical students considering Harvey Mudd should realize that the College’s technical requirements are considerably more demanding than in typical pre-med programs [/quote]  https://www.hmc.edu/biology/programs-and-courses/pre-med-preparation/ So while both paths are theoretically possible at both institutions, you should assume that Amherst sends far more students to med school than into engineering, while HMC sends far more students into engineering than to med school. So in practice, these two schools may not be the best choices if you are truly undecided and want to keep both options open. There are few LACs that are good for both pre-med and engineering. Swarthmore would be an obvious pick, or Smith if you are female. If you can swim competitivelly at a low Division I level, then Bucknell or Lafayette. If you want to stick to Division III, then maybe consider small DIII universities, like Tufts or Rochester, as well as LACs.  ```
Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
You MUST respond ```No preference``` if there is no explicit preference in the comment.
You MUST respond ```Has preference``` if there is explicit preference in the comment.

Based on your responce. What is the preference between the two colleges?
You MUST respond ```A is preferred over B``` if college A is preferred over college B.
You MUST respond ```B is preferred over A``` if college B is preferred over college A.
You MUST respond ```Equal preference``` if colleges A and B are equally preferred.

params.context_instruct:
You will be given two colleges A and B, and a comment. Your job is to identify the preference between the two given colleges in the comment. 
The names of the two colleges and the comment are delimited with triple backticks.

I will ask you the following questions one by one.
1. Is there a preference between the two colleges in the comment?
2. If there is a preference, what is the preference between the two colleges?

Here are the shared rules for both questions:
You MUST NOT use the colleges' real names.
You MUST refer to the colleges as A or B. 
You MUST NOT respond with any other response. 
You MUST NOT make up a preference when there is no preference in the comment.
